constructor-arg.value: Does this study involve aspects of biomedical research, social-behavioral research, or both?

entry.value: Subgroups of subjects or sub-studies with different consent forms
Anticipated number of study subjects (if relevant to consent)
Compensation to subject (e.g., payment, course credit)
Risk of harms or discomforts beyond those in daily life

constructor-arg.value: Select any of the following study aspects that apply.
What is the title of your study?
If you have more than one group of subjects or sub-studies with different consent forms, what is the brief sub-title/identifier for this form (e.g., "Control Group," "RPP Subjects," "Study 1")?

Who is the Principal Investigator (PI) or Faculty Sponsor?

Enter UC Berkeley study personnel as they are listed in eProtocol for this study.

Note: Although an undergraduate, graduate, postdoctoral student or staff person may be the lead researcher on a project, they may not serve as study PI. A Faculty Sponsor is required in such cases. Please read Personnel Titles and Responsibilities: Roles in eProtocol before completing this section.

Use the PI's academic title (e.g., "Professor Jane Martin"). Note: In consent forms, the title "Dr." should only be used for MDs.
Lead Researcher Other Than UCB Faculty
Who is the student, postdoc, or other individual acting as lead researcher on the study?
What is the UCB status of the lead researcher given in previous question. For example, "a graduate student."
What is the UCB school/department affiliation of the Principal Investigator (PI) or Faculty Sponsor?

property.name: defaultText
property.value: The purpose of this research study is to

constructor-arg.value: Not required, but if appropriate: State total accrual goal for number of subjects. Give a short description about cohorts, if any. For multi-site studies, note other sites and give figures both for the whole study and for local enrollment at UC Berkeley. (If not applicable, skip to the next question).

property.name: defaultText
property.value: Approximately ___ people will take part in this study.

constructor-arg.value: Why is the individual being asked to take part in this study?

property.name: defaultText
property.value: We are inviting you to participate in this study because

constructor-arg.value:
Select screening procedures to be done in this study.

If the procedure is not listed, specify "Other" and you will be asked to provide a description.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: Blood draw (venipuncture): You will be asked to give a blood sample for lab tests. Approximately «XX [teaspoons or other commonly understood unit such as ounces/ml]» of blood will be drawn by inserting a needle into a vein in your arm.

constructor-arg.value:
Complete the description below.

(For pregnancy testing to be done prior to MRI or fMRI procedures, see CPHS Guidelines on MRI in Research for details.)

property.name: defaultText
property.value: Pregnancy test: Because the procedures/drugs to be used can affect a fetus, pregnant women may not participate in this study. If you are a female of child-bearing potential (i.e., you have had your first menstrual period and have not yet reached menopause), a urine «or blood» test will be done at the initial visit «or other time» to make sure you are not pregnant.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: HIV testing: Some of the blood sample will be used to test for HIV (human immunodeficiency virus). You will receive the test results in person and will be counseled about the meaning of these results before and after the test «or as accurate/appropriate»

constructor-arg.value: Describe any other screening procedures below.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: Other:

constructor-arg.value: How long with screening procedures take? Estimate duration.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: The screening procedures will take a total of «...» minutes («...» hours).

constructor-arg.value: List and describe randomization procedure(s) to be done.

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
Randomization: You will be randomly assigned to one of the study groups described below. This means that the group you are in will be chosen by chance, like the flip of a coin. You will have an equal chance of being placed in «either/any» group.

  • If you are in Group 1 «Explain what will happen for this group.»
  • If you are in Group 2 «Explain what will happen for this group.»
  • «Etc.»

Other information (e.g., single-blind, double-blind, placebo-controlled, etc.)

constructor-arg.value:
Select main social-behavioral procedures to be done.

If the procedure is not listed, specify "Other" and you will be asked to provide a description.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will be asked to complete a questionnaire about «describe themes, types of questions». «Describe method, e.g., "The questionnaire is completed online" or "the questionnaire is on paper and you write in your answers"». This should take about «## minutes» («# hours»).

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
I will conduct an interview with you at «[e.g., a time and location of your choice]». The interview will involve questions about «themes, types of questions». It should last about «## minutes» («# hours»).

«If applicable:» I expect to conduct only one interview; however, follow-ups may be needed for clarification. If so, I will contact you by mail/phone to request this. «Provide brief information about follow-up interviews including time frame, maximum number, types of questions if different from the original, etc.»

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will ...

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will ...

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will ...

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
With your permission, I will make an audio recording and take notes during the interview «/other». This is to accurately record information you provide, and will be used for transcription purposes only «if accurate – adapt if other uses intended, per below». If you choose not to be recorded, I will take notes instead. If you agree to being recorded but feel uncomfortable at any time during the interview «/other», I can turn off the recorder at your request. Or if you don't wish to continue, you can stop the interview «/other» at any time.

«If applicable»: I may want to use some of the audio recordings of you in public presentations related to the research. Please read the attached Media Records Release Form. It outlines several possible uses of the recordings and asks for your specific consent to use them in each way. I will not use any recordings of you in any future presentation without your consent.

constructor-arg.value: Complete the description below with the information for this study.

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
With your permission, I will make a video recording and take notes during the interview «/other». This to accurately record information for this study only «if accurate – adapt if other uses intended, per below». If you choose not to be video recorded, I will take notes instead. If you agree to being recorded but feel uncomfortable at any time during the interview «/other», I can turn off the video recorder at your request «if accurate; if not, describe other options». Or if you don't wish to continue, you can stop the interview «/other» at any time.

«If applicable»: I may want to use some of the video recordings of you in public presentations related to the research. Please read the attached Media Records Release Form. It outlines several possible uses of the recordings and asks for your specific consent to use them in each way. I will not use any recordings of you in any future presentation without your consent.

constructor-arg.value: Complete the description below with the information for this study.

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
With your permission, I will take photographs and take notes during the interview «/other». The photography is to accurately record information for this study only «if accurate – adapt if other uses intended, per below». If you choose not to be photographed, I will take notes instead. If you agree to being photographed but feel uncomfortable at any time during the interview «/other», I can stop taking pictures at your request «if accurate; if not, describe other options». Or if you don't wish to continue, you can stop the interview «/other» at any time.
«If applicable»: I may want to use some of the pictures of you in public presentations related to the research. Please read the attached Media Records Release Form. It outlines several possible uses of the recordings and asks for your specific consent to use them in each way. If you agree to allow these items to be used after this research study is over, please read, initial, and sign the Media Records Release Form in addition to this consent form. I will not use any recordings of you in any future presentation without your consent.

constructor-arg.value: Describe any other main social-behavioral procedures.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will...

constructor-arg.value:
Select main biomedical procedures to be done.

If the procedure is not listed, specify "Other" and you will be asked to provide a description.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: «Indicate number of occasions and/or frequency», a blood sample will be drawn by inserting a needle into a vein in your arm. Each sample will be approximately «XX [teaspoons or other commonly understood unit such as ounces/ml]». A total of about «XX (teaspoons/other)» will be drawn for the whole study.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will have an x-ray of your «part of body, indicate when and/or frequency» in order to check «XXX». Each x-ray will take about «XX minutes / hours».

constructor-arg.value:
Complete the description below.

(See CPHS Guidelines on MRI in Research for detail on consent language, etc.)

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
You will have a Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) exam done «indicate when and/or frequency». The MRI scanner measures small changes in magnetic fields produced in your brain and generates images of the human brain.

For the MRI scan, you will be asked to lie down on a platform that slides into the center of a large magnet. A plastic coil will be placed around your head and foam pads will be placed to limit head movement during the study. You will then be slid into the magnet and asked to lie still for approximately 60 to 90 minutes (1 to 1.5 hours), while the MRI images are acquired.

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
You will have a computed tomography (CT) [or computerized axial tomography (CAT)] scan of your «part of body, indicate when and/or frequency», in order to check «XXX». A CT scan uses special x-ray equipment to make detailed pictures of body tissues and organs.

For the CT scan, you will be asked to lie still on a table with your «XXX» inside a large doughnut-shaped machine. The table will move and the machine will make clicking and whirring noises as the pictures are taken. [If appropriate: An iodine dye (contrast material) will first be «injected into a vein/given to you orally/rectally». The dye makes tissue and organs more visible in the pictures.] Each CT scan will take about 15 to 30 minutes.

constructor-arg.value:
Edit the description below.

(See CPHS Guidelines on Human DNA/Genetics Research for detail on consent language, etc.)

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will be asked for a cheek swab to sample cells for DNA testing. This involves briefly wiping the inside of your cheek with a cotton swab.

property.value: We hope that the information gained from the study will help...

constructor-arg.value: List the possible risks and/or discomforts of study participation and describe each one.

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
Some of the research questions may make you uncomfortable or upset. You are free to decline to answer any questions you don't wish to, or to stop the interview «/other» at any time.

«Other»

constructor-arg.value:
Select the applicable risks and/or discomforts of study participation.

If there may be unknown risks, select that option and you will be asked to provide context.

Complete the description below with the information for this study.

(See CPHS Guidelines on MRI in Research for detail on consent language, etc.)

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
MRI: The magnets in the MRI scanner are extremely powerful and will attract any metallic objects brought into the MRI room, so you must be careful to leave anything made of metal outside the room. People with pacemakers, heart rhythm disturbances, or certain metallic implants in their body cannot participate in this study. You will be screened for these conditions.

While there are minimal risks from MRI as it is to be performed and MRI scanning is painless, participation may involve some discomfort. In particular, you may be bothered by the loud noise during the study that is due to beeping and hammering sounds made when the scanner is collecting measurements. Disposable earplugs will be provided to diminish the noise. Also, some people become claustrophobic while inside the scanner. (Individuals with a history of claustrophobia, which is a fear of being enclosed in small spaces, will be excluded from the study.) You may also experience stimulation of the nerves in your body, which feels like a gentle tap or sensation of mild electric shock.

[«If appropriate:» We will be able to communicate with you during the session via an intercom system.] If you feel uncomfortable in the scanner for any reason, please let us know and we will stop the procedure.

constructor-arg.value:
Complete the description below with the information for this study.

(See CPHS Guidelines on MRI in Research for detail on consent language, etc.)

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
CT scan: CT scans involve the risks of radiation. The amount of radiation you will be exposed to is relatively small. Such doses of radiation may be potentially harmful, but the risks are so small that they are difficult to measure. If you have already had many x-rays or are especially concerned with radiation exposure, you should discuss this with the researchers before agreeing to be in the study.

In addition, if contrast material (iodine dye) is used, there is a slight risk of developing an allergic reaction, from mild (itching, rash) to severe (difficulty breathing, shock, or rarely, death). The contrast material may also cause kidney problems, especially if you are dehydrated or have poor kidney function. The study doctors will ask you about any allergies or related conditions before the procedure. If you have any of these problems, you may not be allowed to have a CT scan «/continue in the study».

Having a CT scan may mean some added discomfort for you. In particular, you may be bothered by feelings of claustrophobia when placed inside the CT scanner, or by lying in one position for a long time. If contrast material is used, you may feel discomfort when it is injected «/given by XXX». You may feel warm and flushed and get a metallic taste in your mouth. Rarely, the contrast material may cause nausea, vomiting, or a headache. «List other risks as appropriate to the method by which contrast agent is administered]«. «If sedation may be used, discuss risks here]«.

constructor-arg.value: Complete the description below with the information for this study.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: If you are in the group that receives placebo, your condition will go without the active (study) treatment for «XX weeks/months».

constructor-arg.value: You may provide context for any unknown risks below.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: The experimental treatments may have side effects that no one knows about yet. The researchers will let you know if they learn anything that might make you change your mind about participating in the study.

constructor-arg.value: Will participants be asked for their agreement to release identifiable information about them?

How will data be collected/de-identified to protect confidentiality? Choose the measure(s) you will use and edit appropriately.

See CPHS Data Security Policy for further detail about subject confidentiality.

Note: Since there is no legal privilege between investigator and subject, a guarantee of complete/strict confidentiality should not be given or implied in the form.

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
The data will be collected anonymously. We will not maintain a link between your identity and the research data.

Personal identifiers will be removed «state point in study when this will occur, e.g., "immediately after audio recordings have been transcribed."»

Other «(describe)»

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
Only I/the researcher(s) will have access to your study records.

Only my faculty advisor and I will have access to your study records.

Your personal information may be given out if required by law. Organizations that may look at and copy your medical records for research, quality assurance, or data analysis include:
«List relevant organizations, e.g., study sponsor, FDA (if study involves drugs, devices, or biologics regulated by the FDA), etc.»

«If there is a reasonable expectation (from topic under study and/or target subject population) that reportable information may be disclosed to the researcher during the study, use wording such as:»
«Sensitive/reportable research information»: We will keep your study data as confidential as possible, unless it is certain information that we must report for legal or ethical reasons, such as child abuse, elder abuse, or intent to hurt yourself or others.

constructor-arg.value: Has a Certificate of Confidentiality been obtained from the NIH for this study?

The [audio/video recordings] will be transcribed and the tapes will be erased at the end of the study.

The research data will be retained for _____ and then destroyed.

The research data will be destroyed at the end of the study.

constructor-arg.value: Will specimens be collected as part of this study?

If there are any alternatives to participation beyond not taking part in this study, describe the available alternative(s). (E.g., if subjects are students and course credit is given for participation, an alternative assignment of equal or lesser difficulty must be offered, and should be referenced here.) If not, skip to the next form.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: As an alternative to participating in this study, you may choose to

constructor-arg.value: If subjects will be compensated, describe the type of compensation (e.g., payment by cash/ check, gift card, course credit). Note total amount of compensation per participant and if applicable, describe the breakdown of compensation per procedure, visit, session, or task. Also describe any provision for pro-rating of compensation.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will receive «type and amount of compensation» for your participation in this study. You will receive «insert type and amount of compensation] [frequency - every Xth visit or per procedure/visit/session/task».

constructor-arg.value: Describe any costs (e.g., transportation, standard of care, etc.) for which the participant or a third party payer will be responsible. If none, submit the statement below.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: You will not be charged for any of the study activities.

constructor-arg.value: If the study involves risk of harms or discomforts beyond those encountered in daily life, complete the UCOP-required statement below:

property.name: defaultText
property.value:
It is important that you promptly tell the researcher «investigator’s name», if you believe that you have been injured because of taking part in this study. You can tell the researcher in person or call «her/him» at «[phone number]».

If you are injured as a result of taking part in this study, University of California will provide necessary medical treatment. The costs of the treatment may be billed to your insurer just like other medical costs, or covered by the University of California [«if applicable:» or the study sponsor, «sponsor name»], depending upon a number of factors. The University and the study sponsor do not normally provide any other form of compensation for injury. For more information in this regard, call OPHS at (510) 642-7461.

constructor-arg.value: Who can the participant call with concerns, problems or questions about the study? Include the name of the Principal Investigator, Student Investigator, or designated researcher and their corresponding phone number and email address, in first paragraph below. If there are additional/alternate contacts, list name, role in study, and contact information (including phone and email address) as indicated below.

property.name: defaultText
property.value: If you have any questions or concerns about this study, you may contact _________ at «phone number» or «email address». Or you may contact ____________«list name, role in study, and contact information for any other study personnel or local contacts».

constructor-arg.value: If known, what is the CPHS protocol number for the study? (If not known at this time, insert in footer of the Word version of consent form after CPHS number is assigned.)
Would you like to generate a Word-format consent form now? (You can do this from the home page as well.)
